snippet: Cameroon is part of a regional force that includes soldiers from Chad, Niger, Nigeria and Benin in a fight against Boko Haram, which has become a major threat to West Africa.
abstract: Cameroon's military says it has killed at least 100 members of Boko Haram and has freed 900 people held hostage by militant Islamist group.
lead_paragraph: Cameroon is part of a regional force that includes soldiers from Chad, Niger, Nigeria and Benin in a fight against Boko Haram, which has become a major threat to West Africa.

headline.main: Cameroon: Troops Kill 100 Militants and Free Hostages Held by Boko Haram
headline.print_headline: Africa; Cameroon: Troops Kill 100 Militants and Free Hostages Held by Boko Haram
